articles.title: Lecce wins again to move clear of Serie A relegation zone
articles.original_title: Lecce wins again to move clear of Serie A relegation zone
articles.summary: Lecce beat Cagliari 2-0 and gained a vital three points in its struggle to avoid relegation from Serie A on Monday.  The southern club remained in 17th place but the win took it three points clear of the relegation zone.  Omri Gandelman put Lecce ahead with a header after 65 minutes, and Ylber Ramadani doubled the lead 11 minutes later with a powerful shot into the bottom corner.

articles.title: Own goal dispatches giant-killer Macclesfield as Brentford moves into FA Cup fifth round
articles.original_title: Own goal dispatches giant-killer Macclesfield as Brentford moves into FA Cup fifth round
articles.summary: Brentford will face West Ham in the fifth round of the FA Cup after dispatching Macclesfield 1-0 on Monday, an own goal ending the fairy tale run of the sixth-tier giantkiller.  The Macclesfield part-timers knocked out cup holder Crystal Palace in the last round and were hailed for pulling off one of the greatest shocks in the competition’s long history.  The big defender dived to cut out a cross from Aaron Hickey but instead diverted the ball past his own keeper.

articles.title: Yankees captain Aaron Judge, like many fans, fretted for much of offseason over lack of moves
articles.original_title: Yankees captain Aaron Judge, like many fans, fretted for much of offseason over lack of moves
articles.summary: Aaron Judge fretted like many Yankees fans as big-name free agents kept signing elsewhere.  “It was brutal,” the New York captain said Monday after the year's first full-squad workout.  Judge spoke at length about the Yankees' lack of World Series title since 2009, of homering and striking out against 22-year-old flamethrower Carlos Lagrange during the workout, about captaining the U.S. in the upcoming World Baseball Classic and last year's elbow injury.
